texto: 7.4.1 General description Measurement system analysis (MSA), also referred to as “measurement uncertainty analysis”, is a set of procedures to evaluate the uncertainty of measurement systems under the range of conditions in which the system operates. Measurement uncertainty should be considered wherever data are collected. MSA is used for assessing, at a prescribed level of confidence, whether the measurement system is suitable for its intended purpose.
